mathlib3D
Class Point3D

java.lang.Object
  mathlib3D.Point3D
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable
public class Point3D
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Cloneable, java.io.Serializable

Defines a three-dimensional homogeneous point. Each Point3D object contains four components: X, Y, and Z, the 3-dimensional coordinates of the point, and W, the homogeneous component.

Version:
4.10 02/19/05
Author:
William Dimaculangan, Monika Jankun-Kelly, John Clevenger
See Also:
Serialized Form

          Creates a new Point3D with defaults of X,Y,Z = 0.0 and W = 1.0.

          Creates a new Point3D given three coordinates.
Point3D(double X, double Y, double Z, double W)
          Creates a new Point3D given three coordinates and a W value.

Constructor Detail

Point3D

public Point3D()
Creates a new Point3D with defaults of X,Y,Z = 0.0 and W = 1.0.

Point3D

public Point3D(double X,
               double Y,
               double Z)
Creates a new Point3D given three coordinates. The default value for W is 1.0.

Point3D

public Point3D(double X,
               double Y,
               double Z,
               double W)
Creates a new Point3D given three coordinates and a W value.

Returns the Y component of this Point3D object.

public double getZ()
Returns the Z component of this Point3D object.

getW

public double getW()
Returns the W component of this Point3D object. W is is another name for the homogeneous component.

public java.lang.Object clone()

Overrides:
clone in class java.lang.Object

minus

public Point3D minus(Point3D p2)
Returns a new Point3D whose X,Y,Z values are the difference between this point's X,Y,Z and the specified point's X,Y,Z. The new Point3D's W value is the default (1.0).

distanceTo

public double distanceTo(Point3D p2)
Returns a real number that is the distance between this point and the specified point.

add

public Point3D add(Point3D p2)
Returns a new Point3D whose X,Y,Z values are the sum of this point's values and the specified point's values. The new Point3D's W value is the default (1.0).

mid

public Point3D mid(Point3D p2)
Returns a new Point3D which is the midpoint between this point and the specified point. The new Point3D's W value is the default (1.0).

mult

public Point3D mult(double theMultiplier)
Returns a new Point3D which is the result of multiplying this point by the given multiplier. The new Point3D's W value is the default (1.0).

div

public Point3D div(double theDivisor)
Returns a new Point3D which is the result of dividing this point by the given divisor. The new Point3D's W value is the default (1.0).

mult

public Point3D mult(Matrix3D mat)
Returns a new Point3D which is the result of multiplying this point by the given matrix. Multiplication is done "from the right". That is, this method returns a new point P' such that P' = [givenMatrix] x [thisPoint].

scale

public void scale(double scaleFactor)
Scales each of the X, Y, and Z components of this point by the given scaleFactor. Note that unlike most Point3D methods, this method does NOT return a new Point3D; it scales THIS point. The W value in the point is unchanged.

toString

public java.lang.String toString()
Returns a printable representation of this Point3D.

Overrides:
toString in class java.lang.Object
